definition: shaking and vibration at the surface of the earth resulting from underground movement along a fault plane of from volcanic activity
opposite_reasoning: GeologicalStability provides the strongest conceptual opposition to Earthquake at the appropriate ontological level. While Earthquake represents sudden, violent seismic disruption, GeologicalStability captures the complementary state of tectonic equilibrium. This is a process/state-level opposition that is semantically coherent and maximizes the distinction for Fisher-LDA (high μ+ - μ- separation). The concept is likely present in SUMO's geological/physical process hierarchy. If unavailable, 'Stillness' serves as a more general but accessible alternative that captures the motion/stability dimension.
